content: modern stripes baby blanket by kelly komejan crafts a modern take on the baby blanket with alternating single crochet and simple patterned stripes it works up quickly and is easy enough for even new crocheters it s easy to adjust to a different size too depending on the yardage of your yarn this would be beautiful done in just two colors too plus it s completely reversible supplies 1 skein each berroco modern cotton 209 yds/skein or any worsted weight yarn #1603 piper color a #1624 salty brine color b #1628 iggy color c #1614 vireo color d #1611 rocky point color e #1657 lippet color f #1663 hope color g size h crochet hook or size needed for gauge and a hook one size larger although gauge is not critical for this project it may effect yardage needed the patterned stripes in this blanket used the entire skein of yarn and the single_crochet stripes took just shy of the whole skein if your skeins have different yardage or if you re gauge is different you may want to adjust the size of the stripes or the width of the blanket the pattern stitch is a two stitch pattern repeat so you can change the stitch count at the beginning by a multiple of two stitches and the pattern will still come out right finished size 31 ¾ x 42 gauge 14 sts x 17 row = 4 in single_crochet directions stripe 1 with color a and larger crochet hook chain 112 switch to smaller hook for rest of the project row 1 working through bumps on back of chain single_crochet in second chain from hook and in each chain across 111 sts row 2 ch1 does not count as a stitch turn single_crochet in each st across repeat row 2 until stripe measures 6 or to desired size stripe 2 with color b attach yarn with a slip_stitch row 1 ch1 counts as single_crochet double_crochet into same stitch chain is coming out of *skip next st work 1sc and 1dc into next stitch repeat from * to last 2 st skip 1 st single_crochet into last st turning chain from previous row turn repeat row 1 until stripe measures 6 or desired size stripe 3 1 kellykomejancrafts@gmail com with color c attach yarn with a slip_stitch row 1 ch1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet in each st across including turning chain from previous row 111 sts turn row 2 chain 1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet in each single_crochet across turn repeat row 2 until stripe measures 6 or desired size stripe 4 using color d repeat stripe 2 stripe 5 using color e repeat stripe 3 stripe 6 using color f repeat stripe 2 stripe 7 using color g repeat stripe 3 weave in ends abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet
